Articles.Content:
Just to give everyone a sense of size, here is how the Delta IX is designed:

First stage is 5m with 3.75m CBC boosters.

J2X EDS stage is 4.25m.

And the RL60 cryo stage fits inside the fairing.

Also, the CBC's and first stage have crossfeed between each other.

The CBC's are only for a Delta IX Heavy, normal Delta IX has no boosters.

Edited September 26, 2015 by _Augustus_
oops, been getting side-tracked again...learning Blender presently for a major animation project with another Online friend
I've put together a small team to identify the bugs and fix them, we should be up and running soon.

I've put together a small team to identify the bugs and fix them, we should be up and running soon.

Ok, it will take me a little longer than I thought to get you the information you need. Game keeps crashing on me!

Ok, it will take me a little longer than I thought to get you the information you need. Game keeps crashing on me!

Any Null refs?

Don't know how to check...

- - - Updated - - -

At first, it was crashing due to too many active mods. now, it crashes in the opening screen after you choose a save
Try active texture managment
lol, yeah, I was trying to avoid having to use it, but I suppose I have no choice! too many good mods!
Huge congrats to the team who found liquid water on Mars!!

Huge congrats to the team who found liquid water on Mars!!

Yeah, maybe Mark Watney didn't have a water problem after all...
Hey, just a heads up, from my early testing (locating parts in the VAB), I found it really difficult to find stuff. what company is this set for?
I'm not sure, I'll PM the guy who made the parts later
When will you release? I have been follow this for a month, but i haven't figure out how to post a reply on the forum

When will you release? I have been follow this for a month, but i haven't figure out how to post a reply on the forum

After testing and bug fixes are complete. The reason you are having issues is that, initially, your posts are moderated to remove spam and spam bots. After at least three posts, i think, your posts won't be chacked by the moderators prior to being added to a thread

When will you release?

#soon. The plan is Friday. I'll be doing some recon and data gathering (seeing the movie) on Saturday. We will release then at the ABSOLUTE latest. We're already almost a month behind schedule but I think we're on the homestretch.

You know, it's just my personal opinion, but I think you shoudn't worry too much about schedules. When I'm working on something for one of my mods, I just say "OK, you finish the, well I don't know, RS-27A let's say, in mid-december. Then I start working on it, and I'm doing well, but then the time is over and I'm still working on it, because I think that some parts of it should look better etc.

I just think that you should roughly say when you want to have it finished, and if you realize that you still need more time, just take it and ignore the schedule!

I exceeded my schedule for my Atlas V by almost 2 and 1/2 months, but I really needed the time.

So don't rush only because you're behind schedule, do it properly.

Ps.: And I won't tell now how far I am behind my schedule with Delta IV. Let's just say it's more than a few months

Thanks Kart :-). I said that at the absolute latest we'll release the same day as the movie, and we're not far off. Also, if anyone is really good at engine effects, send a pm my way and I'll put you to work. Besides that, we're done.

Douglas Adams said it best when it comes to deadlines.

Hype!
I think you guy should do an update after the details in the movie be reveiled. Or some of you should rather mail Andy Weir and ask him.

Release is tommorrow. Expect bugs. Testers, keep on testing. If someone could PLEASE make so effects for the main engine I couldn't give you enough rep. It currently only includes the rocket, but that'll be fixed soon.

Thanks for staying with this whole time.

Major Leauge
Can't wait. I'm sure it will be great.

Still have to see it later though.
